__TOC__


Here we have a sampling of bugs to work on for Hug Day.  After you have triaged or fixed a bug put your name in the last column and set the row's background to green by adding '''lightgreen''' in the first cell of the column after "background-color:" and before ";".  This will let people know that the bug in that row has been hugged.  

You might find it more convenient to edit the wiki page using <code>editmoin</code> a command line utility for editing moinmoin wiki pages.  It is available as a package in Gutsy and Hardy.  More information including an easier way to do this was <nowiki>[[https://lists.ubuntu.com/archives/ubuntu-bugsquad/2007-November/000666.html|mailed]]</nowiki> to the Bug Squad. 

=== 5-a-day-ing ===

During hug days you can also do <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day|5-A-Day]]</nowiki> for this one you can do the following in order to tag your work on the hug day:
 
* 5-a-day --add-tag hugday-20080506
* Add bugs to 5-a-day as usual 
* And when done with hug day run: 5-a-day --remove-tag hugday-20080506

More information about <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/5-A-Day#Tag|tags here]]</nowiki>.

=== 142 bugs New bugs tagged apport-bug about Firefox 3.0 ===
These bugs have been reported via the "Help -> Report a Problem" menu item and contain some detailed information about the bug reporter's system.  Additionally, they may not necessarily be bugs about Firefox 3.0 so might need to be assigned to the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/FindRightPackage|proper package]]</nowiki>.

If the bug is in fact a bug report about Firefox the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingFirefox|debugging procedures]]</nowiki> will help you gather the right information.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Assign the bug report to the proper package '''or'''
* Follow up with the reporter, set the status to '''Incomplete''' and subscribe yourself '''or'''
* Recreate the bug report, make it more complete (title, screenshot, what you tested with) and set the status to '''Confirmed'''

=== 90 bugs New bugs tagged apport-bug about Firefox 2.0 ===
These bugs have been reported via the "Help -> Report a Problem" menu item and contain some detailed information about the bug reporter's system.  Additionally, they may not necessarily be bugs about Firefox 2.0 so might need to be assigned to the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/Bugs/FindRightPackage|proper package]]</nowiki>.

If the bug is in fact a bug report about Firefox the <nowiki>[[https://wiki.ubuntu.com/DebuggingFirefox|debugging procedures]]</nowiki> will help you gather the right information.

'''To mark it off the list you should:'''
* Assign the bug report to the proper package '''or'''
* Follow up with the reporter, set the status to '''Incomplete''' and subscribe yourself '''or'''
* Recreate the bug report, make it more complete (title, screenshot, what you tested with), and set the status to '''Confirmed'''
